Question.value: 3. How many people are dependent on your income?
Question.Ans: 1 other person in your household besides yourself

Question.value: You are nearing your target to purchase an expensive mobile phone. However, just short of the purchase, your income stream takes a big hit. Your reaction will be to?
Question.Ans: Buy a product which is priced at less than the original phone which you aimed to buy
Buy the phone and all the accessories for which you hadn't previously planned

Question.value: 5. Having made a decision to save & acted upon it. How do you feel?
6. How would you describe your income stream?
Question.Ans: Not important, as you have a benefactor
Going to be change and will become less

Question.value: 7. You invest Rs. 10,000 in a stock that goes down by 10% the next day. How would you react?
Question.Ans: Purchase more, and use this as an opportunity to accumulate
You are unflinched by short term changes
Cut your losses short, pull the money out and reinvest in a safe instrument
Wait for the price to revert to your purchase price and obtain your capital back

Question.value: 8. What sort of remuneration excites you?
9. What is your savings philosophy closest to?
Question.Ans: Savings should be proactive, a minimum amount should be saved irrespective of how much you earn

Question.value: 10. How do you educate yourself on your investments?
Question.Ans: Avid reader of magazines and TV channels pertaining to finance
Subscriber to a pink paper and one other financial magazine
I skim through the Business section of my daily newspaper
I track market prices on my phone

Question.value: 11. Which personality trait best describes you?
12. How would you rate your knowledge of investing?
Question.Ans: Poorly informed investor and rely on distributors/investment managers
I'm a babe in the woods when it comes to financial planning

Question.value: 13. How many years can you comfortably retire in?
14. How would you describe your financial decisions?
Question.Ans: Based on thorough analysis of all options

Question.value: 15. When you suffer a financial loss, what are your feelings?
Question.Ans: Cut your losses short and move on

Question.value: 16. Your company is offering severance pay. How would you react?
Question.Ans: Take it as you were in any case looking out for another job
Worry about the continuity of business and start looking for a job elsewhere

18. How would you describe your current staying arrangement?
Question.Ans: Live in my own house but would like something better

Question.value: 19. How much do you save each month?
Question.Ans: Depend on PF of employer as savings
I save more than 30% without fail every month
I save and I'm comfortable with the current situation
